summary_short: • The hotel receptionist initially describes lavish amenities of 'the hotel next door' before offering basic, self-service instructions for his own.
• He refuses a room when a discount code is offered but readily finds availability without it.
• The receptionist, who is also the manager, nonchalantly admits forgetting a customer's wake-up call, causing him to miss his flight.
• He charges the customer's credit card for his 'debts' and later expresses confusion about check-in/checkout processes.
• The receptionist ends a check-in attempt by asking the customer what he wants with his 'chicken' while displaying a chicken image on a laptop.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video, titled "WORST Hotel Receptionist EVER!", humorously portrays a series of frustrating and absurd customer service interactions at a hotel. The receptionist, Charles, greets a customer and begins by enthusiastically describing luxurious amenities like an infinity pool with a cocktail bar, a 24-hour luxury spa, and a Michelin-starred chef. However, he quickly clarifies that these features belong to "the hotel next door," then dismissively instructs the customer to "Find any room that is not full" for his current stay.

The customer attempts to use a discount code, to which Charles claims all rooms are booked. When the customer offers to forgo the discount, rooms miraculously become available. This leads to the customer's frustration, demanding to speak to the manager, only for Charles to reveal he *is* the manager. The absurdity continues as the customer complains about missing a flight due to a forgotten wake-up call; Charles confirms the oversight, casually stating, "Ah yes. I forgot."

During a payment attempt, Charles processes the customer's credit card for unspecified "debts" before asking if he'd like to pay for the hotel room as well. Later, when the customer tries to check in, Charles bafflingly asserts he "only do checkouts" and then asks for the key card back. In a subsequent interaction, the receptionist performs bizarre stretches and asks the customer to see the manager, then responds in a high-pitched voice when asked to check in. The video culminates with Charles pulling up a laptop with a chicken image, asking, "And what exactly would you like with your chicken?", solidifying his role as the 'worst hotel receptionist ever'.

timeline.title: Receptionist describes wrong hotel's amenities
timeline.note: Charles describes luxurious features, then clarifies they are for the hotel next door, and vaguely tells the customer to find any available room.

timeline.title: Discount code controversy
timeline.note: Charles denies room availability with a discount code, but rooms become available immediately when the customer offers to pay full price.

timeline.title: Managerial reveal
timeline.note: A frustrated customer asks to speak to the manager, and Charles dramatically reveals he is the manager.

timeline.title: Forgotten wake-up call
timeline.note: Charles confirms he forgot to give the customer a wake-up call, causing him to miss his flight, and nonchalantly admits, 'I forgot'.

timeline.title: Charging 'my debts'
timeline.note: Charles processes the customer's credit card and, when asked what the charge was for, states it was for 'my debts'.

timeline.title: Check-in vs. Checkout confusion
timeline.note: The customer attempts to check in, but Charles states he 'only do checkouts'.

timeline.title: Customer forced to checkout
timeline.note: Charles takes the key card back and points the customer towards the exit, bidding him 'goodbye'.

timeline.title: Bizarre check-out stretches and manager request
timeline.note: The customer requests to check out, and Charles performs strange back stretches and poses, then asks the customer to see the manager (himself).

timeline.title: The 'chicken' check-in
timeline.note: During another check-in attempt, Charles pulls out a laptop showing a chicken image and asks what the customer would like with his 'chicken'.

glossary: Charles The French: The actor playing the hotel receptionist/manager.
Customer: The man interacting with the receptionist.
Hotel next door: A luxurious hotel whose amenities the receptionist mistakenly describes.
Discount code: A code the customer attempts to use for a reduced room rate.
Wake-up call: A service the customer requested and that the receptionist forgot to provide.
Credit card: The payment method used by the customer.
Manager: The role Charles claims to hold when confronted by the customer.
The Continent Hotel: The location where the video was filmed, in Bangkok, Thailand.

summary_short: • A customer, still hungry after finishing his ramen noodles, asks the chef for more food.
• The chef introduces 'kaedama', a Japanese cultural practice of adding more noodles to the leftover soup.
• After consuming the additional noodles, the customer expresses he is full.
• The chef then introduces another Japanese custom: adding rice to the remaining ramen broth, dubbing it 'Ramen Risotto'.
• Despite the customer's protests of being full, the chef insists he must finish the ramen soup with rice, emphasizing it's part of the culture.
entries.summary_detailed: The video opens with a customer at a ramen restaurant passing his empty ramen bowl back to the chef, stating he is "still hungry." The chef, smiling, responds by saying he will show the customer "Japanese culture." He then proceeds to prepare "Kaedama," which is explained as an 'add-on Noodle'. The chef swiftly drains hot water from a basket of noodles and expertly adds them into the customer's nearly empty ramen bowl, which still contains some broth. The customer accepts the additional noodles, enjoying them. After finishing the kaedama, the customer declares he is "full now" and thanks the chef by saying "Gochisousama." However, the chef is not finished. He presents a small bowl of white rice to the customer, who protests, reiterating, "But I'm full already!" The chef playfully refutes this, saying "No, you're not!" He then empties the bowl of rice directly into the customer's ramen bowl, which now only contains a small amount of broth and the remnants of the noodles. The chef takes a small torch and briefly flames the top of the rice and broth mixture. He then emphatically tells the customer, "You have to finish ramen soup with rice." The final shot shows the chef presenting the dish, which he refers to as "Ramen Risotto," encouraging the customer to try it, implying that finishing the meal in this manner is a customary practice.

timeline.title: Customer requests more food
timeline.note: A customer pushes his bowl forward and tells the chef he is still hungry.

timeline.title: Chef introduces Japanese culture
timeline.note: The chef smiles and states, 'Okay, let me show you Japanese culture.'

timeline.title: Chef prepares and adds Kaedama
timeline.note: The chef prepares and adds a serving of fresh noodles, labeled 'Kaedama: add-on Noodle', to the customer's bowl.

timeline.title: Customer finishes Kaedama and expresses fullness
timeline.note: After eating the Kaedama, the customer says he's full and uses the Japanese phrase 'Gochisousama'.

timeline.title: Chef offers rice, customer protests
timeline.note: The chef presents a bowl of rice, and the customer protests, saying he's 'full already!'

timeline.title: Chef adds rice to soup and torches it
timeline.note: The chef adds the rice to the remaining ramen soup and uses a torch to slightly char the top.

timeline.title: Chef explains the tradition
timeline.note: The chef instructs the customer that he 'have to finish ramen soup with rice'.

timeline.title: Chef presents 'Ramen Risotto'
timeline.note: The chef presents the finished dish, which he labels as 'Ramen Risotto'.

summary_short: • A streamer is confronted by an Italian restaurant owner.
• The owner claims to be a 'gangster' and part of 'the mob,' demanding the streamer leave.
• The owner states he has received '30 calls' about the streamer.
• The streamer apologizes and immediately begins packing his belongings to depart.
• The streamer exits the restaurant, expressing thanks for the business and acknowledging the threat.
entries.summary_detailed: The video captures a tense confrontation at an Italian restaurant involving streamer Iceposeidon and an older man identified as the restaurant owner. The incident begins with the streamer asking an unknown person about their number. Subsequently, the restaurant owner leans into the frame, speaking in a low, assertive tone. He informs the streamer that he has received "about 30 calls" concerning him on his phone. The owner then explicitly identifies himself, stating, "I'm a gangster," and issues a direct threat: "So you better fucking leave here right now before there's trouble with yourself." He further warns the streamer, emphasizing, "You're fucking with the mob over here. You better leave now." The streamer, showing visible surprise and compliance, immediately apologizes and begins to pack his equipment, stating, "I will be gone then." The owner reiterates the demand for departure, advising, "The sooner you leave, the better." As the streamer prepares to exit, he offers a sarcastic, "Thank you very much for your business." He then quickly leaves the establishment, continuing to film, and remarks to himself, "I don't wanna fuck with the mob," acknowledging the gravity of the situation.

timeline.title: Streamer asks for number, owner approaches
timeline.note: The streamer is seen holding a phone and asks 'What's her number?' as an older man leans into the frame.

timeline.title: Owner claims calls and identifies as 'gangster'
timeline.note: The owner tells the streamer he's received '30 calls' about him and declares, 'I'm a gangster.'

timeline.title: Owner threatens and demands departure
timeline.note: The owner instructs the streamer to 'fucking leave here right now before there's trouble with yourself.'

timeline.title: 'Fucking with the mob'
timeline.note: The owner warns, 'You're fucking with the mob over here.'

timeline.title: Final demand and streamer's apology
timeline.note: The owner tells him to 'better leave now,' and the streamer apologizes.

timeline.title: Urgency to leave
timeline.note: The owner states, 'The sooner you leave, the better.'

timeline.title: Streamer prepares to exit
timeline.note: The streamer begins packing his belongings, confirming, 'I will be gone then.'

timeline.title: Streamer thanks and leaves
timeline.note: The streamer says, 'Thank you very much for your business' as he stands up and starts to walk away.

timeline.title: Streamer's post-confrontation remark
timeline.note: As he walks out, the streamer says to himself, 'I definitely don't wanna fuck with the mob.'

glossary: Streamer (Iceposeidon): The individual filming the video, with purple hair and a red and white shirt.
Italian Restaurant Owner: The older man with glasses who confronts the streamer, claiming to be a 'gangster' and associated with 'the mob'.
Gangster: A term used by the restaurant owner to describe himself during the confrontation.
The Mob: A term used by the restaurant owner to refer to the group he is affiliated with.
Italian Restaurant: The establishment where the confrontation occurs, featuring an outdoor dining area.
Phone: The device the owner claims to have received '30 calls' on, leading to the confrontation.

summary_short: • A customer attempts to order in English at a McDonald's drive-thru in Puerto Rico.
• The McDonald's employee, named Donald, patiently assists the customer with their order despite a language barrier.
• The order includes two McDouble combos with medium fries and Sprite, and one additional solo McDouble.
• Barbecue sauces are requested, and the employee clarifies that sauces would be charged extra if not paired with nuggets.
• The total order amounts to $13.56, which the customer pays by card, and receives a receipt.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video captures a customer's experience ordering at a McDonald's drive-thru in Luquillo, Puerto Rico, navigating a language barrier with the staff. Upon arriving at the speaker, the customer initiates the order in English, to which the employee, Donald, responds in Spanish. The customer then asks if they speak English, but the employee indicates limited proficiency. The customer proceeds to order two McDoubles, using a mix of broken Spanish and English. They are directed to the window to continue the order.

At the window, another employee, wearing a 'Lovin' Puerto Rico' shirt, apologizes for not speaking English well. The customer then orders two McDouble combos. They initially request large fries ('papas') and a large Sprite. However, the employee informs them that the McDouble combos only come with medium-sized options for fries and drinks, which the customer accepts. The customer also asks for four barbecue sauces. The employee communicates that extra sauces not accompanying an order of nuggets would incur an additional charge. The customer then adds one more McDouble, ordered 'solo' (alone) without a combo, bringing the total McDoubles to three.

The employee patiently summarizes the complete order: two McDouble combos with medium fries and Sprite, and one solo McDouble. The customer confirms the order is correct. The total charge for the order is $13.56. The customer pays using a credit card and receives the receipt, reflecting on the friendly service despite the communication challenges.

timeline.title: Arriving at McDonald's Drive-Thru
timeline.note: The driver approaches the McDonald's drive-thru, passing various signs and waiting in line.

timeline.title: Initial Order Attempt and Language Inquiry
timeline.note: The customer tries to order in English at the speaker; the employee (Donald) greets them in Spanish. The customer then asks if staff speak English.

timeline.title: Ordering McDoubles and Directed to Window
timeline.note: The customer attempts to order 'two McDoubles' and 'large papas' in a mix of English and Spanish, and is directed to proceed to the window.

timeline.title: Service at the Window and Drink Order
timeline.note: An employee at the window, wearing a 'Lovin' Puerto Rico' shirt, apologizes for not speaking English well. The customer confirms two McDoubles and requests a large Sprite.

timeline.title: Combo Size Clarification
timeline.note: The employee informs the customer that McDouble combos are only available in medium size, which the customer accepts.

timeline.title: Barbecue Sauce Request
timeline.note: The customer asks for four barbecue sauces.

timeline.title: Order Confirmation for Combos
timeline.note: The employee confirms the order for two McDouble combos with medium fries and Sprite.

timeline.title: Adding a Solo McDouble
timeline.note: The customer adds an extra McDouble, specifying 'solo' (alone) and not as part of a combo.

timeline.title: Sauce Policy and Customer Acceptance
timeline.note: The employee explains that barbecue sauces will be charged if not with nuggets. The customer seems to accept the terms.

timeline.title: Language Barrier Resolution
timeline.note: The employee briefly considers calling someone who speaks English but proceeds with the order after the customer indicates it's fine ('está bien').

timeline.title: Final Order Summary by Employee
timeline.note: The employee verbally summarizes the complete order: two McDouble combos with medium fries and Sprite, and one solo McDouble, for a total of three McDoubles.

timeline.title: Payment and Receipt
timeline.note: The employee states the total is $13.56. The customer pays with a credit card and receives the receipt.

timeline.title: Receipt Review and Reflection
timeline.note: The customer reviews the McDonald's receipt, noting the items ordered and reflecting on the experience in Puerto Rico with their 'broken Spanish'.

glossary: McDonald's Luquillo: The specific McDonald's location in Puerto Rico where the order was placed.
Donald: The first McDonald's employee who takes the order via the drive-thru speaker.
McDouble: A specific burger item from the McDonald's menu.
Papas: Spanish term for fries, ordered by the customer.
Sprite: A lemon-lime flavored soft drink, ordered by the customer.
Combo: A meal deal that typically includes a main item, a side, and a drink.
Solo: Spanish for 'alone' or 'only', used to specify a McDouble ordered without a combo.
Barbecue sauce: A condiment requested by the customer.
Lovin' Puerto Rico: The slogan printed on the red uniform shirt worn by the McDonald's employee at the window.
Estaba bien: Spanish phrase meaning 'it's okay' or 'it's fine', used by the customer during the ordering process.

summary_short: • Traveled from Busan to Pohang via KTX, encountering issues with power plugs on the train.
• Explored Pohang's quiet atmosphere, visited a fish market, and enjoyed a highly praised local meal of cold raw fish bibimbap and fish soup.
• Visited Gyeongju, exploring its 'museum without walls' atmosphere and the illuminated Upsong Fortress at night.
• Learned about Upsong Fortress's history, its eastward orientation ('facing the sun'), and observed its reconstructed wall.
• Concluded the trip by taking an earlier KTX train directly from Gyeongju back to Busan.
entries.summary_detailed: The segment begins with the speaker and his companion preparing to board a KTX train from Busan to Pohang, with a transit stop in Dongdaegu. They encounter issues with power plugs on the train, noting only pillar seats have them. Arriving in Pohang, they observe the town's older, less busy atmosphere, resembling a small town. They find a fish market, noting the hot weather and Pohang's steel industry. They have a meal at a local eatery, featuring cold raw fish bibimbap and fish soup, receiving sea urchin as a complimentary side dish. The meal is highly praised for its taste and value. After leaving Pohang, the journey continues to Gyeongju where the speaker explores a quiet neighborhood at night, arriving at the illuminated Upsong Fortress. He describes Gyeongju as a "museum without walls" due to its numerous historical sites, highlighting the Shilla Dynasty's Islamic influence. Entering the fortress gate, he notes its similar interior design to one in Suwon and explains that 'Upsong' means 'facing the sun,' signifying its eastward orientation. After admiring the restored gate and walking along the well-lit reconstructed fortress wall, observing the quiet town, they head to the KTX station to catch an earlier direct train back to Busan.

timeline.title: Boarding KTX
timeline.note: Speaker and companion prepare to take a KTX train from Busan to Pohang, transiting at Dongdaegu.

timeline.title: Power Plug Issue
timeline.note: They encounter difficulties with the train's power plugs, noting only seats near pillars have them.

timeline.title: Arrival in Pohang
timeline.note: They reach Pohang Station, noting the town's quiet atmosphere and hot weather.

timeline.title: Fish Market Exploration
timeline.note: They explore a fish market, observing various seafood and dried anchovies.

timeline.title: Lunch at Eatery
timeline.note: They find an affordable eatery, enjoying cold raw fish bibimbap, fish soup, and complimentary sea urchin.

timeline.title: Leaving Pohang
timeline.note: After their meal, they head towards Pohang Station to catch a bus.

timeline.title: Praise for Pohang Food
timeline.note: The speaker praises the unique taste of the fish dishes and complimentary items in Pohang before moving on.

timeline.title: Arrives at Upsong Fortress, Gyeongju
timeline.note: The man reaches the historic Upsong Fortress at night, describing Gyeongju as a 'museum without walls'.

timeline.title: Enters Fortress Gate & History
timeline.note: He enters the ornate gate, noting its similar interior design to Suwon's fortress and reading historical information.

timeline.title: Explains Gate Name & Walks Wall
timeline.note: He explains that 'Upsong' means 'facing the sun' and walks along the illuminated, reconstructed fortress wall.

timeline.title: Departs Gyeongju for Busan
timeline.note: After exploring, he heads to the KTX station to catch an earlier direct train back to Busan.

summary_short: • A container overturned in Carson after its trailer's landing gear collapsed; two tow trucks prepare for a complex 'barrel roll' recovery of the 36-ton unit.
• The video then shifts focus to a separate large red container, found severely leaning due to shifted internal weight, which workers assess for stabilization and solutions.

• For the initial rolled container (holding 36,000 lbs of batteries), crew members decide to offload its contents; a crane lifts and meticulously repositions it horizontally, revealing water leakage, while a yard goat prepares its chassis.

• Following the recovery and preparation of the rolled container, the crew consults with a customer to confirm the precise final placement of a container, discussing optimal spacing potentially using a forklift.
• The delivery team then expresses gratitude to the customer, announces job completion in Carson, California, and confirms the customer will now offload the container.
entries.summary_detailed: The video initially details a container rollover incident in Carson, California, where a large container overturned after its trailer's landing gear sank into concrete. The narrator discusses the container's estimated 36-ton weight with a customer, and two tow trucks prepare rigging for a 'barrel roll' recovery. The video then shifts focus to a separate challenging scenario, where workers assess a large red container severely leaning on its trailer due to shifted internal weight. A crane maintains tension while a worker climbs to detach chains, emphasizing the risk of it toppling if crane support is released. Potential solutions for this unstable container, including offloading its contents or utilizing a landall, are discussed. The crew later returns their attention to the initial rolled container, which is noted to hold 36,000 lbs of batteries that caused a weight shift. They decide to offload its contents, and a yard goat is brought in to position the chassis. A tow truck with a crane attachment then hooks onto the rolled container, lifting it to reveal water leaking from its underside. The operator meticulously adjusts the crane's counterweight and boom to horizontally move and stabilize the container, securing it with chains as the yard goat prepares to connect air lines to the chassis for subsequent movement. Finally, workers consult with the customer for precise final container placement, considering options like using a forklift for optimal spacing. After confirming the position and expressing gratitude to the customer, the delivery team announces job completion in Carson, California, explaining that the customer will now offload the container.

timeline.title: Container Rollover Explained
timeline.note: Narrator explains how a container overturned due to a landing gear sinking into concrete.

timeline.title: Container Weight Discussion
timeline.note: Narrator discusses the container's approximate weight with a customer.

timeline.title: Initial Rigging Setup
timeline.note: Narrator attaches a blue shackle and gray sling to one corner of the container.

timeline.title: Second Side Rigging
timeline.note: Narrator retrieves yellow chains and secures them to the opposite corner of the container.

timeline.title: Second Tow Truck Rigging
timeline.note: The second tow truck (Castro's) begins attaching its slings and hooks to the container for the barrel roll operation.

timeline.title: Leaning Container Assessment & Weight Shift Confirmed
timeline.note: Workers assess a large red container severely leaning; crane operator confirms extreme lean due to shifted internal weight.

timeline.title: Stabilizing Leaning Container & Solutions Discussed
timeline.note: A worker detaches chains from the red container under crane tension, and solutions like offloading or using a landall are discussed.

timeline.title: Offloading Rolled Container & Yard Goat Approach
timeline.note: Crew decides to offload the rolled container (36,000 lbs of batteries), and a yard goat begins backing up to its chassis.

timeline.title: Crane Lifts & Repositions Rolled Container (Leak Revealed)
timeline.note: A tow truck crane lifts the rolled container, revealing water leaking, and the operator adjusts settings to reposition it horizontally.

timeline.title: Yard Goat Prepares Chassis for Rolled Container
timeline.note: Chains are secured to the rolled container, and the yard goat operator connects air lines to the chassis for preparation.

timeline.title: Final Container Placement, Customer Consultation & Job Completion
timeline.note: Workers consult with the customer for precise container placement, discussing forklift use for spacing, confirm position, and announce job completion for customer offloading.

summary_short: • Explores key cultural differences between French and US restaurant customer service.
• Highlights the impact of tipping, take-out culture, and demanding clientele in the US.
• Features insights from the owners of Côté d'Azur Restaurant on adapting to US consumer expectations.
entries.summary_detailed: This initial segment introduces Rochelle DeMeo and the owners of San Diego's Côté d'Azur Restaurant, Christophe, Natasha, and their baby Victor. They delve into the distinct characteristics of French versus US restaurant cultures, focusing on cuisine (French and Mediterranean). Natasha emphasizes the prominent role of tipping and the high customer service expectations prevalent in the United States. Christophe points out the significant increase and acceptance of take-out and delivery services in the US, especially post-COVID-19. He concludes by noting that American customers are generally more demanding, often expecting highly personalized service and reacting strongly if specific menu items are unavailable, pushing restaurants to adopt agile, just-in-time operational models.

timeline.title: Owners Introduced
timeline.note: Rochelle introduces Christophe, Natasha, and their baby Victor, owners of Côté d'Azur Restaurant.

timeline.title: Cuisine Offered
timeline.note: Natasha explains they serve French and Mediterranean dishes.

timeline.title: Tipping and Service
timeline.note: Natasha discusses higher tipping and customer service expectations in US restaurants.

timeline.title: Take-Out Culture
timeline.note: Christophe highlights the democratized take-out and delivery options in the US, especially since COVID-19.

timeline.title: Demanding Clientele
timeline.note: Christophe notes US customers are more demanding, reacting negatively if specific dishes are unavailable.

summary_short: • A customer (wearing a cowboy hat) calls 'Coin Jar' customer service, claiming a coin machine took all his money.
• The customer service agent (the same actor, now wearing glasses and suspenders) calmly instructs the confused customer to print a receipt.
• The customer initially struggles to understand the concept of a receipt and taking it to a cashier.
• After persistent explanation from the agent, the customer suddenly realizes he has the receipt.
• The customer thanks the agent, having understood that he needs to take the receipt to the cashier for his money.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video presents a humorous customer service sketch where the same actor plays both the frustrated customer and the patient customer service agent. The sketch opens with the 'customer,' a man wearing a cowboy hat and a bolo tie, on the phone, looking stressed. He attempts to contact 'Coin Jar' customer service, stating, 'The machine took my money,' claiming it consumed all his quarters, dimes, pennies, and nickels.

The 'customer service agent,' initially heard as an off-screen voice, clarifies, 'We did not take your money,' seemingly misunderstanding 'Coinjar' as a personal entity rather than a company name. As the conversation progresses, the scene cuts to the 'agent,' now visually portrayed by the same actor but wearing glasses, a shirt, and suspenders, patiently attempting to guide the confused customer. The agent calmly instructs the customer to 'print the receipt and take it.' The customer, still in his cowboy hat persona, is baffled, repeatedly asking, 'What receipt? What are you talking about?'

The agent reiterates the instructions, explaining, 'You gotta take it to the cashier,' further elaborating, 'the woman or man at the register,' and specifically 'the people at the registers.' The customer remains perplexed until the agent rephrases, asking, 'Can you print the receipt and take it over to the register?' At this point, the customer has an epiphany, exclaiming, 'Oh, I see the receipt! Oh, I've got the receipt here!' The agent, with a slight smile of relief, acknowledges, 'Okay. All right,' and simply says, 'Take it to the register.' The customer quickly responds, 'Okay, all right, thank you,' and abruptly ends the call, signaling a successful, albeit dramatically drawn-out, resolution to his coin machine dilemma.

timeline.title: Customer initiates call
timeline.note: Man in cowboy hat calls 'Coin Jar' customer service.

timeline.title: Customer states problem
timeline.note: He claims the machine took his money.

timeline.title: Agent denies involvement
timeline.note: Off-screen agent responds, 'We did not take your money.'

timeline.title: Customer lists lost coins
timeline.note: He specifies 'all my quarters and all my dimes and all my pennies, all my nickels and everything.'

timeline.title: Agent provides first instruction
timeline.note: The agent (now visible, in glasses/suspenders) says, 'You have to print the receipt and take it.'

timeline.title: Customer expresses confusion
timeline.note: The customer asks, 'What receipt? What are you talking about?'

timeline.title: Agent clarifies recipient
timeline.note: Agent states, 'You gotta take it to the cashier.'

timeline.title: Agent explains 'cashier'
timeline.note: Agent clarifies it's 'the woman or man at the register' and 'the people at the registers.'

timeline.title: Customer understands
timeline.note: Customer exclaims, 'Oh, I see the receipt! Oh, I've got the receipt here!'

timeline.title: Agent confirms next step
timeline.note: Agent says, 'Okay. All right. Take it to the register.'

timeline.title: Call ends
timeline.note: Customer thanks agent and hangs up.

glossary: Customer Service Agent (man in glasses and suspenders)

summary_short: • A restaurant manager engaged in a heated argument with a police officer over mask mandate compliance.
• The manager repeatedly refused requests to leave his building, claiming it was his property and an 'emergency way'.
• As more officers arrived, the manager became agitated, repeatedly demanding an ambulance and accusing the police of being embarrassing.
• The manager was eventually arrested and physically escorted out of the building by multiple police officers.
• His assistant attempted to retrieve the manager's phone from the police outside but was unsuccessful before the manager was placed into a police van.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video captures a escalating confrontation between a restaurant manager and New South Wales Police officers. The incident begins with a single police officer, wearing a mask and visor, confronting the bald, bearded manager in a suit about "two girls without a mask" and asking him to leave the premises. The manager denies an offense was committed and aggressively refuses to comply, stating, "This is my building" and pushing back against the officer's attempt to guide him towards a doorway he labels an "emergency way." He accuses the officer of being a liar and refuses to discuss the matter further.

The verbal dispute intensifies as the manager repeatedly demands that the officer leave his building, asserting his right to remain. The officer maintains that the manager is uncooperative and that an offense has been committed, having previously asked for IDs. The manager then asks the officer if he should call "car crews" (police backup). Shortly after, additional police officers arrive, surrounding the manager. Growing increasingly agitated, the manager loudly and repeatedly demands that the police call an ambulance, claiming his staff needs immediate medical attention and calling the officers' actions "embarrassing." A female officer then informs him he is under arrest and must accompany them to the car.

Despite the manager's continued protestations, demands for an ambulance, and accusations of the police being "idiots," he is physically taken into custody and escorted out of the building by the group of officers. Outside, a man identified as his assistant asks the police about the manager's phones, attempting to retrieve them. Although one officer states the manager can make a call if he has his phone, the assistant's request to take the phones is ultimately denied. The video concludes as the manager is secured in the back of a police van and driven away.

timeline.title: Initial Confrontation
timeline.note: A police officer confronts the restaurant manager about two girls without masks; manager denies discussing it and calls the officer a liar.

timeline.title: Refusal to Leave
timeline.note: Officer repeatedly asks the manager to step outside; manager refuses, stating he is on the phone and that it's his building.

timeline.title: Escalating Demands
timeline.note: Manager tells officer not to run into him and demands he leave his building; officer states an offense occurred and asked for IDs; manager asks if he should call 'car crews'.

timeline.title: Police Reinforcements Arrive
timeline.note: Multiple police officers arrive; manager becomes agitated, repeatedly demands an ambulance, and calls the police 'embarrassing'.

timeline.title: Arrest Announced
timeline.note: Manager continues to yell for an ambulance, calling officers 'idiots'; a female officer informs him he is under arrest.

timeline.title: Physical Escalation
timeline.note: Manager is surrounded by officers and continues to yell for an ambulance before being moved.

timeline.title: Escort from Building
timeline.note: The manager is physically escorted out of the building by police officers.

timeline.title: Manager Led Away
timeline.note: The manager continues to be escorted down a ramp and out of the building.

timeline.title: Outside the Building
timeline.note: Manager is held against a police van; his assistant expresses concern and asks for the manager's phones.

timeline.title: Phone Request Denied & Departure
timeline.note: Assistant's request for the manager's phone is denied; the manager is placed into the police van, and the door is closed.

glossary: Restaurant Manager: The bald, bearded man in a suit, the subject of the confrontation.
Police Officer 1: The initial police officer, wearing a mask and visor, who first engages the manager.
Police Officers: The group of law enforcement personnel from New South Wales Police.
Assistant: A male individual present towards the end of the video, attempting to retrieve the manager's phone.
Masks: The protective face coverings, compliance with which sparked the initial confrontation.
IDs: Identification documents requested by the police from the individuals without masks.
Ambulance: Emergency medical services repeatedly demanded by the manager during the altercation.
Building: The commercial premises, identified by the manager as 'my building', where the confrontation occurs.
Police Van: The vehicle used to transport the arrested manager.
000: Australia's emergency telephone number, mentioned by the manager.

summary_short: • A woman, identified as 'Karen', falsely accuses a black 14-year-old boy of stealing her iPhone in a SoHo hotel lobby.
• The boy's father defends his son, asserting the phone belongs to his son and criticizes the woman's irrational accusations.
• The woman claims her 'Find My iPhone' feature is active and demands proof of ownership from the boy.
• A hotel manager attempts to intervene, but the father perceives his actions as unhelpful and disrespectful.
• The woman physically lunges at the boy, attempting to prevent him from leaving, before the father successfully guides his son away.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video documents an incident in a SoHo hotel where a woman, referred to as 'Karen,' falsely accuses a black 14-year-old boy of stealing her iPhone. The boy's father, who is recording the interaction, immediately steps in to defend his son, stating unequivocally that the phone in question belongs to his son. The woman aggressively demands that the boy prove the phone is his, questioning why he wouldn't do so if it were truly his. The father challenges her logic, remarking, "Are you kidding me? You feel like there's only one iPhone made in the world?" The woman retorts by claiming her 'Find My iPhone' feature is activated, implying she can track the device.

A hotel manager, wearing a mask and formal attire, attempts to mediate the escalating confrontation. However, the father views the manager's involvement as unhelpful and disrespectful, stating, "You're not helping. What you've been is disrespectful." He emphasizes that his son has no connection to the woman's alleged theft. The situation intensifies when the woman physically attempts to block the boy and lunges at him, loudly declaring, "No, I'm not letting him walk away with my phone!" The father repeatedly urges his son to "get on" and leave the area, physically guiding him away from the woman and the immediate vicinity of the hotel lobby. The video ends as the father and son move away from the scene.

timeline.title: Intro Animation
timeline.note: A logo animation for 'FORTNITETOM' plays.

timeline.title: Initial Accusation and Father's Defense
timeline.note: A woman confronts a boy, and the father intervenes, stating the phone belongs to his son.

timeline.title: Argument over iPhone Ownership
timeline.note: The father questions the woman's assumption of phone uniqueness, while she demands proof of ownership.

timeline.title: Woman Claims 'Find My iPhone'
timeline.note: The woman states her 'Find My iPhone' feature is active.

timeline.title: Manager's Intervention and Father's Frustration
timeline.note: A hotel manager attempts to mediate, but the father finds him unhelpful and disrespectful, emphasizing his son's innocence.

timeline.title: Woman Demands Proof Again
timeline.note: The woman reiterates her demand for the boy to prove the phone is his.

timeline.title: Father Tells Son to Leave
timeline.note: The father instructs his son to 'get on' and exit the situation.

timeline.title: Physical Confrontation and Exit
timeline.note: The woman lunges at the boy to prevent him from leaving, while the father guides his son away.

timeline.title: Outro Animation
timeline.note: The logo animation for 'FORTNITETOM' plays again.

glossary: Karen: The woman in the white hat and black attire who falsely accuses the boy.
14-year-old boy: The black teenager falsely accused of theft.
Father: The individual recording the video and defending his son.
Hotel Manager: The male staff member in a white shirt and mask attempting to de-escalate the situation.
SoHo Hotel: The location where the incident takes place.
iPhone: The object of contention, which the woman claims was stolen.
False Accusation: The act of wrongly blaming someone for a crime or wrongdoing.
Theft: The act of dishonestly taking property belonging to someone else with the intention of permanently depriving the owner of it.
Find My iPhone: A feature on Apple devices used to locate a lost or stolen iPhone.

summary_short: • A waiter, Willis, in a Chinese restaurant called Golden Palace, serves unordered food to a table, claiming it's theirs now.
• He becomes visibly frustrated with a customer named Caitlin who is indecisive about her order after a long wait.
• Willis aggressively offers a spoonful of food to Caitlin, stating he doesn't care if she likes it or not.
• He then rudely interacts with another table, refusing to give specials or recommendations, leading to a customer's amusement and Willis threatening to quit.
• The restaurant manager confronts Willis, expressing confusion about the clientele and asking about Willis's whereabouts, despite Willis being present.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video opens inside the Golden Palace, a traditional Chinese restaurant adorned with festive red decorations and Chinese artwork. Willis, a waiter in a formal vest and bow tie, attempts to serve dishes. He approaches a table where a female customer, identified as Caitlin, points out that the food he is carrying is not theirs. Willis, displaying a deadpan and unhelpful demeanor, insists that since he has placed the food on their table, it is now theirs, disregarding their protests that they haven't even ordered yet. Caitlin's friend adds that Willis had been 'hiding in the kitchen for like 20 minutes'.

When asked what they would like to order, Caitlin expresses indecision. Willis becomes highly sarcastic, calling her prolonged indecisiveness his 'favorite game' and implying she has wasted his time. He then tells her to explicitly state her name and her lack of a decision. Caitlin is surprised he knows her name, to which Willis dismissively responds that he is 'just a waiter' and cannot solve her 'existential indecisiveness.' He then takes a spoon of food from the plate he's holding and pushes it towards her, telling her to 'give this a try' and emphasizing that he 'doesn't care' if she likes it.

Moving to another table, Willis greets the customers and, when asked about specials or recommendations, curtly states that 'every dish is special' and advises them to 'pick before I walk away.' A male customer at the table finds Willis's bluntness amusing and chuckles quietly, which further agitates the waiter. Willis declares, 'That's it, I'm out,' and begins to walk away from the table. He is stopped by an older man, presumably the manager, who pulls him aside and, in a moment of apparent bewilderment, asks Willis, 'Who are all these white people? Where do they come from?' The manager also confusingly asks 'where's Willis?', despite speaking directly to him. The video ends with an off-screen voice asking for a photo.

timeline.title: Waiter walks through restaurant
timeline.note: A waiter, Willis, walks through the Golden Palace restaurant carrying two plates of food.

timeline.title: Unordered food served
timeline.note: Willis serves unordered food to a table with Caitlin, declaring it theirs now.

timeline.title: Customer indecision
timeline.note: Caitlin says she's 'not sure' what she wants, and her friend mentions the waiter's long absence.

timeline.title: Waiter's frustration over indecision
timeline.note: Willis expresses annoyance at Caitlin's indecisiveness after 20 minutes, calling it his 'favorite game'.

timeline.title: Caitlin's name revealed
timeline.note: Willis tells Caitlin to vocalize her indecisiveness, surprising her by knowing her name.

timeline.title: Forcing food on customer
timeline.note: Willis dismisses Caitlin's 'existential indecisiveness' and forces a spoonful of food towards her.

timeline.title: Interaction with new table
timeline.note: Willis approaches a new table, refuses to recommend dishes, and demands they pick quickly.

timeline.title: Waiter threatens to quit
timeline.note: A customer laughs at Willis, prompting him to declare, 'That's it, I'm out!'.

timeline.title: Manager's unusual questions
timeline.note: The manager confronts Willis, questioning the presence of 'white people' and asking about 'Willis'.

glossary: Willis: The waiter in the Golden Palace restaurant.
Caitlin: A female customer at the first table who is indecisive about ordering.
Golden Palace: The name of the Chinese restaurant where the events take place.
Manager: The older man who confronts Willis about the customers and Willis's own whereabouts.
Existential indecisiveness: A term used by Willis to describe Caitlin's inability to choose her meal.
White people: A term used by the manager to refer to the restaurant's new clientele.

summary_short: • An angry customer threw a cup of soup at a 24-year-old restaurant manager, Janelle Broland, in Temple, Texas.
• The incident was captured on CCTV, showing the customer walking away immediately after the assault.
• Janelle Broland reported that while the soup wasn't hot enough to burn, its spices caused eye irritation and a nosebleed.
• Prior to the physical assault, the customer had called to complain and was verbally abusive and cursing in the restaurant.
• The customer, later identified as a nurse at a local hospital, committed the act after being asked to calm down or leave.
entries.summary_detailed:
This video details a disturbing incident that occurred in Temple, Texas, where a customer threw soup at a restaurant manager. The incident, which took place on November 7, 2021, at approximately 1:19 PM, was captured by CCTV footage. The video's purpose is to document and report on this act of customer aggression.

Key points of the event include the identification of the victim as 24-year-old Janelle Broland, the restaurant manager. According to Broland, the customer had initially called to complain about her order. Upon arriving at the restaurant, the customer continued her aggressive behavior, cursing loudly within earshot of families and children. Janelle Broland attempted to de-escalate the situation by requesting the customer to calm down or leave, and informed her that she would call the police if the disruptive behavior persisted. Broland even offered to continue assisting the customer if she ceased her yelling and cursing. However, in an immediate and violent response, the customer threw her cup of soup directly into Janelle Broland's face.

Following the assault, the customer promptly exited the premises. Janelle Broland recounted the physical effects of the incident, noting that although the soup's temperature was not sufficient to cause burns, the spices from the soup caused her eyes to sting and burn, and even led to a nosebleed. The customer was later identified through social media accounts as a nurse employed at a local hospital, bringing a layer of public scrutiny to the event. The video highlights a severe instance of customer misconduct and the potential hazards faced by service industry employees.

timeline.title: Introduction to the Incident
timeline.note: Narrator introduces the shocking video of a customer throwing soup at a restaurant manager's face.

timeline.title: Incident Details and Victim ID
timeline.note: The incident happened in Temple, Texas, and the manager is identified as 24-year-old Janelle Broland. The customer first called to complain.

timeline.title: Soup Thrown at Manager
timeline.note: CCTV footage shows the customer throwing a cup of soup directly into Janelle Broland's face.

timeline.title: Customer Exits and Identification
timeline.note: The customer walks out of the restaurant. It is mentioned she has been identified as a nurse at a local hospital.

timeline.title: Manager Describes Injuries
timeline.note: Janelle Broland explains that the soup's warmth didn't burn her, but the spices caused her eyes to sting and burn, and led to a nosebleed.

timeline.title: Customer's Behavior Before Attack
timeline.note: Janelle Broland states the customer was making a scene and cursing in front of families and children in the restaurant.

timeline.title: Manager's Warning to Customer
timeline.note: Janelle Broland told the customer to calm down or leave, threatening to call the police.

timeline.title: Final Exchange and Attack
timeline.note: Janelle Broland offered to help if the customer stopped yelling, which was the moment the customer threw the soup.

summary_short: • The presenter arrives at a rural Thai massage shop and meets a mid-50s masseuse.
• They discuss massage options, the masseuse's interest in working in Korea, and her daily earnings.
• The massage includes intense techniques, flirtatious banter, and the presenter expresses interest in an aroma massage for the next day.
• The masseuse shares a photo of her 25-year-old daughter, whom the presenter finds attractive.
• Playfully declaring herself his "secret wife," the masseuse facilitates the exchange of her daughter's phone number for a potential date.
entries.summary_detailed: The video opens with the presenter arriving at a rural Thai massage shop, which is initially locked. After a short wait, a woman in her mid-50s, who had just showered, opens the door. She offers Thai massage (250 Baht) or oil massage (400 Baht). The presenter opts for a 1-hour Thai massage focusing on his head and shoulders for 350 Baht. During the session, they converse about Korea, with the woman expressing a strong desire to work there. The massage begins on his feet, progresses to his thighs, where she uses her elbow with surprising intensity. The session is characterized by lighthearted banter, with the woman playfully hinting at continuing the "party" with him. She also discusses her daily earnings, noting 250 baht for a two-hour Thai massage and potentially 500 baht from two customers per day. The presenter expresses interest in an aroma massage for the following day. Later, the masseuse takes a phone call and then shows a picture of her 25-year-old daughter, whom the presenter finds beautiful. Continuing the playful tone, the masseuse humorously declares herself his "secret wife" and insists he must date her first, joking about the cost of maintaining two wives (mother and daughter). The segment concludes with her giving the presenter her daughter's phone number and wishing him well for a potential date.

timeline.title: Arriving at massage shop
timeline.note: The presenter arrives at a massage shop that appears locked.

timeline.title: Woman opens the door
timeline.note: A woman in a mask opens the shop door, explaining she was showering.

timeline.title: Discussing massage options
timeline.note: They discuss Thai and oil massage prices; the presenter chooses Thai massage for head and shoulders.

timeline.title: Woman talks about Korea
timeline.note: The woman shows excitement about Korea, expressing a desire to work there.

timeline.title: Massage and initial banter
timeline.note: The woman starts massaging, joking about being his 'secret wife' and extending the session.

timeline.title: Masseuse discusses earnings
timeline.note: The masseuse discusses her daily earnings from Thai massages.

timeline.title: Client requests Aroma Massage
timeline.note: The client expresses interest in an aroma massage for the following day.

timeline.title: Daughter's photo shown
timeline.note: The masseuse shows a photo of her 25-year-old daughter to the client.

timeline.title: Masseuse jokes about being 'secret wife'
timeline.note: The masseuse playfully declares herself the client's 'secret wife' and insists on a date first.

timeline.title: Daughter's number exchanged
timeline.note: The masseuse hands the client her daughter's phone number and wishes him a good date.

summary_short: • The video illustrates scenarios of refusing alcohol service to an intoxicated customer, highlighting best practices.
• Initially, the bartender (Maddie) makes a mistake by serving a single G&T after the customer (Em) requests a double, despite Em showing signs of intoxication.
• In a 'try again' scenario, Maddie attempts to refuse service by being overly confrontational, escalating the situation.
• The recommended approach involves a calm, respectful refusal, blaming the law, and offering alternative transport like a taxi.
• Bartenders have a responsibility to assess for intoxication, avoid aggravation, treat customers with respect, and assist them in getting home safely.
entries.summary_detailed:
This RSA training video from NSW Government demonstrates appropriate and inappropriate methods for refusing alcohol service to an intoxicated patron. The primary purpose is to educate hospitality staff on their legal and ethical responsibilities when dealing with customers who appear to be under the influence of alcohol.

The video presents three scenarios involving a customer named Em. In the first scenario, Em, who has already consumed several drinks and shows signs of intoxication, requests a double G&T. The bartender, Maddie, attempts to "rein her in" by serving a single G&T instead of a double. However, this action is quickly highlighted as incorrect, as supplying alcohol to an intoxicated person is against the law and carries heavy fines for both the server and the workplace, leading to negative consequences for Em.

The second scenario shows Maddie attempting to refuse service by being direct and aggressive, telling Em she's had enough, refusing more drinks, and threatening to call security to drag her out within 30 seconds. This approach is depicted as poor practice, as it escalates the situation and fails to consider the bartender's responsibilities to assess for intoxication, avoid aggravation, treat customers with respect, and help them get home.

The final and recommended scenario begins with Maddie observing Em's intoxication and deciding not to serve her. Maddie approaches Em calmly, introduces herself, and, using a friendly and respectful tone, explains that due to the law, she cannot serve Em any more alcohol and must ask her to leave. Maddie offers to call a taxi or find Em's friends to ensure she gets home safely. When Em resists, Maddie firmly reiterates the legal consequences (substantial fines for refusal to leave) and emphasizes that she doesn't want Em to get into trouble, reinforcing the offer of a safe taxi. Maddie then communicates the refusal to security (Rose) via radio.

timeline.title: Customers being served alcohol
timeline.note: Various customers are shown being served alcoholic drinks like ciders and beers in a bar setting.

timeline.title: Customer (Em) requests a double G&T
timeline.note: A female customer, Em, appears at the bar, showing signs of intoxication, and requests a double Gin & Tonic.

timeline.title: Incorrect refusal attempt: Serving a single drink
timeline.note: The bartender, Maddie, serves a standard G&T instead of a double, stating she's uncomfortable giving a double. On-screen text asks, 'Was this the right thing to do?'

timeline.title: Consequences of serving an intoxicated person
timeline.note: On-screen text explains that supplying alcohol to an intoxicated person is against the law, with heavy fines for both the server and the workplace.

timeline.title: Incorrect refusal attempt: Confrontational approach
timeline.note: Maddie directly refuses Em, stating she's had enough, and threatens to call security to drag her out if she doesn't leave in 30 seconds. On-screen text asks, 'Could that have been done better?'

timeline.title: Bartender's responsibilities listed
timeline.note: On-screen text outlines responsibilities: assess for intoxication, don't aggravate the situation, treat customers with respect, help them get home.

timeline.title: Correct refusal: Assessing the situation
timeline.note: Maddie observes Em, noting signs of intoxication, and considers talking to her to rule out medical conditions. She then decides she can't serve Em anymore.

timeline.title: Correct refusal: Calm and respectful communication
timeline.note: Maddie introduces herself, asks Em's name, and calmly refuses service, blaming 'the law'. She then offers to call a taxi or get friends to take Em home. On-screen text: 'Speak in a friendly, respectful manner' and 'Blame the refusal on the law', 'Offer to provide a safe transport option'.

timeline.title: Correct refusal: Handling resistance and offering help
timeline.note: Em resists, but Maddie firmly explains the legal consequences of refusing to leave (fines) and reiterates the offer to call a cab for a safe journey home. On-screen text: 'Take the person away from an audience'.

timeline.title: Bartender notifies security
timeline.note: Maddie uses a walkie-talkie to inform Rose (security) that she has refused service to a young lady (Em) who is intoxicated.

glossary: Intoxication: State of being affected by alcohol to a degree where judgment and physical control are impaired
Licensed Premises: A venue legally permitted to sell and serve alcoholic beverages
Taxi: A safe transport option offered to the intoxicated customer
Walkie-talkie: A device used by Maddie to communicate with security

summary_short: • A customer (Anna) experiences a delayed money transfer, receiving a 'Transfer Still Pending' notification.
• A customer service agent shows frustration over a customer issue, then learns it has been resolved.
• Colleagues inform the agent that the issue was handled by their new Genesys system.
• The agent notices a 'Keep Calm We Have Genesys' sign, understanding the positive impact of the new system.
• Anna's transfer is completed, and Genesys is highlighted as the technology ensuring customer satisfaction and efficient service.
entries.summary_detailed:
The video serves as a promotional piece for Genesys, highlighting how their customer service technology streamlines operations and enhances customer satisfaction. The narrative begins with a customer named Anna, who is in her modern kitchen, preparing to leave with her family. She receives a "Transfer Still Pending" notification on her tablet from "FNB Bank," causing a moment of concern and prompting her to remark, "That's strange." 

The scene then shifts to an office environment where a customer service agent, wearing a headset, appears visibly distressed and frustrated, stretching and sighing at her desk. She then gets up and approaches two of her colleagues, a man identified as Ted and a woman, who are sitting at a table, also wearing headsets. The agent expresses her anxiety about "causing any alarm" regarding a customer issue. Ted quickly identifies the problem as Anna's money transfer, surprising the agent with his insight. Her female colleague reassures her, stating, "It's already taken care of."

Relieved but still curious, the agent asks if Anna has received her money, to which Ted confidently replies, "It's all good. We have Genesys now. Read the sign." He points to a bright red sign on the wall behind them that boldly declares, "KEEP CALM WE HAVE GENESYS." The agent acknowledges the sign, understanding its significance and the clever reference, calling it "good advice." 

The video then returns to Anna in her kitchen. Her tablet now displays a "Transfer Complete" notification, and she smiles, relieved. She calls out to her family, ready to leave. The advertisement concludes with the Genesys logo and the tagline, "WE'RE BEHIND EVERY CUSTOMER SMILE," effectively illustrating how Genesys technology resolves customer issues efficiently, leading to positive outcomes for both customers and customer service teams.

timeline.title: Customer's Pending Transfer
timeline.note: Anna receives a 'Transfer Still Pending' notification on her tablet from FNB Bank.

timeline.title: Agent's Frustration and Resolve
timeline.note: A customer service agent shows frustration at her desk, then stands up with a determined look, stating she'll 'be right back'.

timeline.title: Seeking Colleagues' Help
timeline.note: The agent approaches two colleagues, expressing concern about a customer issue without wanting to cause 'alarm'.

timeline.title: Issue Identified and Resolved
timeline.note: Ted, a colleague, identifies the issue as Anna's money transfer, and another colleague confirms it's 'already taken care of'.

timeline.title: Genesys Introduction
timeline.note: The agent learns Anna has her money, and Ted attributes the resolution to Genesys, pointing to a sign.

timeline.title: Acknowledging Genesys's Impact
timeline.note: The agent reads the 'KEEP CALM WE HAVE GENESYS' sign, appreciates it, and calls it 'good advice'.

timeline.title: Customer's Resolved Transfer
timeline.note: Anna receives a 'Transfer Complete' notification on her tablet and smiles, relieved.

timeline.title: Genesys Tagline
timeline.note: Anna calls her family to the car, and the video concludes with the Genesys logo and the tagline 'WE'RE BEHIND EVERY CUSTOMER SMILE'.
